There was 'Albendazole' instead which is a key ingredient against 'Flubendazole' and known to be inferior. I returned to the pharmacist and told him it's not Zelcom generic but the other one. He pretended like "Ah, there are two kinds of parasiticides I heard..!(??)". And tried to find something and brought me the one which is double the price of normal Zelcom pill but liquid type with sweet flavor. Since I needed many to feed many dogs, asked him to give normal pill type. He said there's none and asked me with a bit questioning tone why I wanted it specifically as if I demanded him something abnormal. I didn't feel like teaching that stupid asshole the difference between the two, so I told him "I don't know why but they(?) specifically want it? Bye." Next time I will be calling a drug store in advance before visiting. Such a shitty cartel of pharmacists doesn't even allow to sell via internet or via over-the-counter in the mart those shitty pills. Not even Aspirin is allowed. [Kings1 3:16 Now two prostitutes came to the king and stood before him.
17 One of them said, “Pardon me, my lord. This woman and I live in the same house, and I had a baby while she was there with me.
18 The third day after my child was born, this woman also had a baby. We were alone; there was no one in the house but the two of us.
19 “During the night this woman’s son died because she lay on him.
20 So she got up in the middle of the night and took my son from my side while I your servant was asleep. She put him by her breast and put her dead son by my breast.
21 The next morning, I got up to nurse my son—and he was dead! But when I looked at him closely in the morning light, I saw that it wasn’t the son I had borne.”
22 The other woman said, “No! The living one is my son; the dead one is yours.” But the first one insisted, “No! The dead one is yours; the living one is mine.” And so they argued before the king.
23 The king said, “This one says, ‘My son is alive and your son is dead,’ while that one says, ‘No! Your son is dead and mine is alive.’ ”
24 Then the king said, “Bring me a sword.” So they brought a sword for the king.

February 5, 2019 is Jan 1 of lunar calendar, and is called New Year, called 설(Surl) in Korea, or 春節(chūnjié) in China. 
.
On Jan 1 of lunar calendar the title of each year changes. There're 60 titles of the years beginning with the year 갑자(Gabja; 甲子) and ending with the year 개혜(Gaehae; 癸亥). After the year Gaehae, it's the year Gabja again. The front letter of a pair of letters which makes up each title is repeated in order of 10 [천간cheongan; 天干; Heavenly Stems](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Heavenly_Stems), and the tail letter is repeated in order of 12 [지지Jiji; 地支; Earthly Branches](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Earthly_Branches). The both letters make up total 60 titles ( = 10 x 12 ). It's a kind of sexagenary numbering system. Each of 10 heavenly stems and 12 earthly branches has its own meaning so that each of 60 titles comes to have a unique meaning as well. 
.
For example it's 기해(Giihae; 己亥) this year. Gii means Yellow and Hae means Pig. People used to call it Golden Pig's year. In Asia, pig as a symbol has a meaning of richness or prosperity, and yellow reminds of gold. So it is believed that it's very lucky year. 
.
How do they make it into their luck? They used to give a special meaning if a baby is born in the year Giihae. And his Asian star sign becomes Pig. But nowadays most people don't give it much meaning anyway. Most times it is used as only marketing purposes, it's like, to induce people to spend some extra money.
.
But it's still meaningful to those who're preparing university entrance exam or civil service exams because in history many historical events were named after the year title of the year it happened. And in my case I even memorized the formula to convert Gregorian calendar year into sexagenary title and vise versa.
.
In regard with the tail letter as the animal sign, Koreans call this a birth star sign 띠(Tii; year of animal) though it's actually not related to horoscope or constellation of the West, but this system was originally created based on Jupiter's 12 year routine anyway. If one was born in 2019, his animal sign is Pig.
.
When you meet someone in Korea and if u feel like asking his/her age, u can ask him/her his/her Tii rather than asking him/her his/her birth year or age directly since it's a little rude. And then u can easily find out how old he/she is if the age gap between u and him/her is less than 24 years. This is the usual way to find out someone's age because it has a little bit of funny thing to talk about animal signs of each other. ( born in 2019 pig, 2020 mouse, 2021 cow, tiger, rabbit, dragon, snake, horse, sheep, monkey, chicken, dog, pig(again). Animal signs were introduced from 12 gods of Buddhism. )
. 
These 12 animal signs or earthly branches have been also used as unit of hours of a day in ancient times by saying each branch points a pair of hours so that total 12 make up 24 hours a day since thousands of years ago. That is, there was also duodecimal numbering system in Asia. 
.
Anyway, if u're going to have time with ur family or friends during Surl holidays, this post will give u a small tip to make a talk with others. 
.
Happy lunar new year! (^\_\~)\_/

Converting a number to base16(=hex):

    echo 'obase=16; 255'|bc; # = FF
Converting a hex number to decimal:

    echo 'obase=10; ibase=16; FF'|bc; # = 255
Wrong way:

    echo 'ibase=16; obase=10; FF'|bc; # = FF
Fixed way:

    echo 'ibase=16; obase=A; FF'|bc; # = 255

.
